title: The Blending Lab 2015 bCS Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Bountiful dark red-fruit aromas meet with cocoa and herbs on the nose of this bottling, which leans toward slightly stewed fruit. The palate is framed by chalky tannins and lively acidity, carrying lavish fruit flavors and making for a very tasty if straightforward sip.

title: The Blending Lab 2015 PS Petite Sirah (Paso Robles)
description: Deep and fresh black currant aromas meet with dried fennel on the nose of this bottling by a winery based in Los Angeles. A penetrating acidity kicks off the sip, where solid tannins carry dark fruit and rosemary flower flavors.

title: The Calling 2016 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: This wine is lovely and expressive in stony mineral, lemon rind, apple, quince and bread. It's medium-bodied, with a pleasant lushness that unfolds on the midpalate.

title: Torricino 2016  Fiano di Avellino
description: Smoke, yellow stone fruit and a whiff of Spanish broom lead the nose. Bright and savory, the enveloping juicy palate delivers yellow apple, lemon and toasted hazelnut alongside fresh acidity and a flinty note.

title: Vie Winery 2013 L'Imaginaire Grenache (Santa Barbara County)
description: Black-plum sauce, star anise, concentrated rose and strawberry-jam aromas make for a luxurious and inviting, if a bit powerful, nose on this bottling. Strawberry paste, white pepper and a gravelly minerality show on the sip.

title: Vigilance 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Red Hills Lake County)
description: Smooth and flavorful, this wine has plenty of pear and light herb aromas. Light spice, mineral and melon flavors offer a good sense of layering on the palate, all leading to a generous mouthfeel and lingering finish.

title: Vinovalie 2014 Les Marches de Cayx Malbec-Merlot (Cahors)
description: Firm and tannic, this is classic Cahors. With its bold tannins and structure permeated with black fruits, the wine is ripe, poised with acidity, flavors of berries and licorice, with a solid aftertaste. Drink from 2021.

title: Viola 2016 Traminer Aromatico Oak Ridge Vineyard Gewürztraminer (Columbia Gorge (WA))
description: Vibrant white flower, lychee and candied ginger aromas are followed by bone-dry fruit flavors in this wine. It shows exquisite length and balance, with a flavorful finish.

title: Wine & Soul 2015 Manoella Red (Douro)
description: From a vineyard in the Pinhão Valley, this lightly structured and fruity wine is buoyed by red fruits and great acidity. Its tannins and acidity are a balanced part of this lightly wood-aged, rich wine. Drink from 2019.

title: Wines & Winemakers 2016 Lua Cheia em Vinhas Velhas Red (Douro)
description: This is an impressive wine with its mineral structure, firm tannins and rich fruit. Dark blackberry flavors are filled out with the solid core of the wine and lifted by the acidity. From a field blend of old vines, the wine needs some aging. Drink from 2021.

title: Castelvecchi 2015 Capotondo  (Chianti Classico)
description: A blend of 88% Sangiovese and 12% Canaiolo, this opens with aromas of iris, red-skinned berry and a hint of fresh mint. The succulent palate doles out red cherry, clove and white pepper alongside polished tannins. It's well balanced, with bright acidity. Drink through 2023.

title: The Calling 2015 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Made by Winemaker Dan Goldfield, this wine is well crafted and earthy. It's a soft, gentle expression of just-picked strawberry that's light in approach and delicate on the palate.

title: Acrobat 2016 Chardonnay (Oregon)
description: The second vintage of this variety for the popular Acrobat brand, this is a fine value: ripe and fruity, with a pleasing mix of citrus and tree fruit flavors. There's a gentle touch of fruit skin bitterness, balanced acidity and a light, butter-inflected finish.

title: Arnaud Baillot 2016 Le Limozin  (Meursault)
description: This wine, young but with good potential, is rich, keeping its crisp character in the background. It is still taut and mineral, although that will change into some altogether riper. This generous wine should be kept until 2020.

title: Boekenoogen 2016 Estate Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: There's a compelling fatness to the nose of this bottling, with broad aromas of nectarine, banana and coconut. That tropicality is present in the palate, with flavors of plumeria and coconut cream, but it's dialed back by a zesty lemon-edged acidity. Both rich and racy, this will appeal to many Chardonnay lovers.

title: Brooks 2015 Sparkling Riesling (Willamette Valley)
description: This is the first sparkling Riesling from Brooks, and it's a stunner. With dry, precise flavors, it's dominated by citrus rind notes and suggestions of rocks. It's penetrating and long, with lemon peel highlights throughout the finish.

title: Casa Santos Lima 2016 Rabo de Galo Reserva Red (Algarve)
description: Not that many Algarve wines find their way out of the region, probably due to thirsty tourists. But with its bold black fruits and firm tannins, this wood-aged wine shows the potential of portions of southern Portugal. It has plenty of spice, warmth from long sunshine hours and finishing acidity. Drink this rich wine now.

title: Castello di Cacchiano 2012  Chianti Classico
description: Aromas of cedar, dark-skinned fruit and baking spice lead the nose on this 70% Sangiovese and 30% Merlot blend. The firm palate offers black plum, clove and toast alongside tight, assertive tannins. Drink 2019–2023.

title: Château les Croisille 2015 Calcaire Malbec (Cahors)
description: From the chalk plateau high above the River Lot, this well-textured wine is packed with fruit and minerality. Its structure is dense, lifted by acidity and softened from wood aging. Still young, it will be better from 2020.

title: Co Dinn 2015 Red Wine Lonesome Springs Ranch Vineyard G-S-M (Yakima Valley)
description: This Syrah-dominated blend has ripe raspberry jam, blueberry pie, dried herb, anise and blackberry aromas that lead to full-bodied dark fruit flavors. It's full-bore in style, like the vintage it comes from.
designation: Red Wine Lonesome Springs Ranch Vineyard

title: Companhia das Quintas 2014 Quinta do Cardo Reserva Touriga Nacional (Beira Interior)
description: Aged for 20 months in wood, this wine is spicy and shows a touch of smokiness. Acidity and the blackberry flavors are balanced with the tannins both of the fruit and the wood aging. This rich wine needs to develop further; drink from 2019.

title: Companhia das Quintas 2015 Quinta de Pancas Reserva Arinto (Lisboa)
description: This is a delicious wine, crisp, fragrant and poised. Lisboa is the Arinto's home region and it shows in the cool character of the wine and the way the wood aging is so well integrated. It is ready to drink.

title: Domaine Chiroulet 2015 Grande Réserve Red (Côtes de Gascogne)
description: From old vines, this wine is impressively rich for Gascony, with firm tannins and generous black fruits. The dense structure is an important part of this ripe wine and needs to soften before it can be drunk. Wait until 2020.

title: Dragonette 2015 Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Forest undergrowth, muddy earth, crushed tarragon, dried mint and dark but not sweet plums show on the nose of this appellation blend. The palate shows earthy clay flavors as well as ripe cranberry and rose petals.

title: Dusted Valley 2015 Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: This combines fruit from Southwind, Sconni Block and Stone Tree vineyards. The aromas are light out of the gate, with barrel spice, fresh herb, black cherry, coffee and mineral notes that become more prominent over time. Concentrated fruit flavors are backed by firm, grippy tannins. The structure is impressive.

title: Etude 2015 Deer Camp Vineyard Pinot Noir (Carneros)
description: Perfumed in rose and violet and velvety smooth, this thick concentrated wine is richly woven in black cherry and black licorice. Its weightiness is youthful yet in check.

title: Famille Laplace 2015 Laplace Tannat-Cabernet Franc (Madiran)
description: Balance is the key when a wine has richness, firm tannins and concentration. The perfume of the Cabernet Franc in the blend gives the wine attractive aromas and smooths out the solid tannins. The wine is made to showcase the Laplace family's skills with Tannat in Madiran. Drink from 2020.

title: Fattoria La Rivolta 2015 Sogno di Rivolta White (Beneventano)
description: A blend of Falanghina, Fiano and Greco, this opens with heady aromas of Spanish broom, tropical fruit, citrus and a whiff of honey. Full bodied and savory, the palate offers pineapple, mature yellow apple and toasted hazelnut alongside bright acidity.

title: Ferguson Crest 2014 Private Reserve Syrah (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Candied blackberry and black currant meet with lilacs on the concentrated gooey nose of this bottling by the pop star Fergie and her father. The thick blackberry note shows on the palate as well, with beef char, a touch of teriyaki and liquefied violets.

title: Fontanavecchia 2016 Taburno  (Falanghina del Sannio)
description: Honeysuckle and tropical fruit aromas leap out of the glass. On the tangy medium-bodied palate, bright acidity balances yellow peach, pineapple and yellow pear while a hint of white almond backs up the close.
